headline.main: Documenting a Death Camp in Nazi Croatia

lead_paragraph: Officials of the United States Holocaust Museum said today that they had discovered and preserved a cache of decaying documents and artifacts from one of the lesser-known but most brutal concentration camps of World War II. The camp, known as Jasenovac, was operated in Croatia by the Ustasha, the Nazi puppet government. The artifacts were found deteriorating in a building in Banja Luka in the Serbian part of Bosnia last year, officials said.
abstract: United States Holocaust Museum officials say that they have discovered and preserved cache of decaying douments and artifacts from Jasenovac, World War II concentration camp operated in Croatia by the Ustasha, Nazi puppet government (M)
